description: Inherited from Middle English caudel, from Old Northern French caudel, from Medieval Latin caldellum, diminutive of Latin caldus, calidus (“warm”).

entries.meaning: A hot drink given to the sick, consisting of wine or ale, eggs, and bread.

verbs.description: caudle (third-person singular simple present caudles, present participle caudling, simple past and past participle caudled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To serve as a caudle to; to refresh.
